## Gerando a amostra

Definindo a pdf para uma indicadora de $U_i$:

```{r discrete}
IU_pdf <- function(n, nu, a = 0, b = 1) {
  unif = runif(n)
  (unif < nu)*a + (unif >= nu)*b
}
```

Gerando uma amostra de tamanho $n$:

```{r sample, echo=TRUE}
IU = IU_pdf(n, nu)
sample = IU * (mu + sigma2*100*rnorm(n)) + (1 - IU)*(mu + sigma2*rnorm(n))
hist(sample, breaks = 50, prob=T)
```

## Definindo *a posteriori*

```{r log_likelihood, echo=TRUE}
A <- function(X, mu, sigma2, nu) {
  n = length(X)
  sum_arg = 0;
  for (i in 1:n) {
    a = (nu/10)*exp(-(X[i]-mu)^2/(2*100*sigma2))
    b = (1 - nu)*exp(-(X[i]-mu)^2/(2*sigma2))
    
    if (a > b) {
      sum_arg = sum_arg + log(a) + log(1+(b/a))
    } else {
      sum_arg = sum_arg + log(b) + log(1+(a/b))
    }
  }
  exp(sum_arg)
}

h <- function(aux, n, mu, sigma2, nu, m, V, a, d) {
  aux * (1/sigma2)^((n+1)/2 + a + 1) * exp(-((mu-m)^2/(2*V) + d) / sigma2)
}

```

```{r inf_params, echo=TRUE}
mu_bounds = 10
mu_grid = seq(m-mu_bounds, m+mu_bounds, 2*mu_bounds/L)

sigma2_grid = seq(0.1, sigma2*2, (sigma2*2 - 0.1)/L)

nu_grid = seq(0, 1, 1/L)
```
